member.name: IQueryAssociations.GetData
member.summary: Searches for and retrieves file or protocol association-related binary data from the registry.
member.param: The ASSOCF value that can be used to control the search.
The value that specifies the type of data that is to be returned.

A pointer to an optional, null-terminated Unicode string with information about the location of the data. It is normally set to a Shell verb such as open. Set this parameter to NULL if it is not used.
A pointer to a value that, when this method returns successfully, receives the requested data value.
A pointer to a value that, when this method is called, holds the size of pvOut, in bytes. When this method returns successfully, the value contains the size of the data actually retrieved.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IQueryAssociations.GetEnum
member.returns: This method does not return a value.

member.name: IQueryAssociations.GetKey
member.summary: Searches for and retrieves a file or protocol association-related key from the registry.
member.param: The ASSOCF value that can be used to control the search.
The value that specifies the type of key that is to be returned.
A pointer to an optional null-terminated Unicode string with information about the location of the key. It is normally set to a Shell verb such as open. Set this parameter to NULL if it is not used.
A pointer to the key's HKEY value.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IQueryAssociations.GetString
member.summary: Searches for and retrieves a file or protocol association-related string from the registry.

param.name: flags
param.para: A flag that can be used to control the search. It can be any combination of the following ASSOCF values.

member.param: An value that specifies the type of string that is to be returned.

A pointer to an optional, null-terminated Unicode string with information about the location of the string. It is typically set to a Shell verb such as open. Set this parameter to NULL if it is not used.
A pointer to a null-terminated Unicode string used to return the requested string. Set this parameter to NULL to retrieve the required buffer size.

param.name: pcchOut
param.para: A pointer to a value that, on entry, is set to the number of characters in the pwszOut buffer. When the function returns successfully, it points to the number of characters placed in the buffer.
If the flag is set in flags and the buffer specified in pwszOut is too small, the function returns E_POINTER and pcchOut points to the required size of the buffer.
If pwszOut is NULL, the function returns S_FALSE and pcchOut points to the required size of the buffer.

returns.para: Returns a standard COM error value, including the following:

listheader.description: The pwszOut buffer is too small to hold the entire string.
pwszOut is NULL. pcchOut contains the required buffer size.

member.name: IQueryAssociations.Init
member.summary: Initializes the interface and sets the root key to the appropriate ProgID.

param.name: flags
param.para: A flag that specifies how the search is to be initialized. It is typically set to zero, but it can also take one of the following values.

param.name: pszAssoc
param.para: A Unicode string that is used to determine the root key. If a value is specified for hkProgid, set this parameter to NULL. Four types of string can be used:
A file name extension, such as .txt.
A CLSID GUID in the standard "{GUID}" format.
An application's ProgID, such as Word.Document.8.
The name of an application's .exe file. The flag must be set in flags.

member.param: The HKEY value of the subkey that is used as a root key. The search looks only below this key. If a value is specified for pwszAssoc, set this parameter to NULL.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IQueryAssociations
member.summary: Exposes methods that simplify the process of retrieving information stored in the registry in association with defining a file type or protocol and associating it with an application.
